alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:50AM EST until December 20 at 4:41AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... East Branch Penobscot River At Grindstone affecting Penobscot County. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Penobscot River at Grindstone. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, State Route 11 flooded and impassable. Homes and camps inundated. Logging roads west and near the river will be flooded. Hathaway Road flooded near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.7 feet. - River is out of its banks. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 04/30/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
